intro: Rhododendron mollianum, commonly known as the Molliana rhododendron, is a species native to the Himalayas, particularly in regions of India and Nepal. It is a shrub that typically grows at high altitudes, often in cool, moist mountainous environments. The plant features broad, leathery leaves and produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically important plants. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, making it a subject of conservation interest.
